title: Just WILD!
text: One the wildest and most overwhelming markets I've ever been to anywhere in the world! There's just soooooo many people, food, clothes, motorcycles, cars,  and the smells! A must do while in Cotonou!
translated_text: One the wildest and most overwhelming markets I've ever been to anywhere in the world! There's just soooooo many people, food, clothes, motorcycles, cars,  and the smells! A must do while in Cotonou!

title: Sehenswert
text: Der Markt ist sehr voll und man wird als wei√üer sehr viel angequatscht. Im Gro√üen und ganzen haben viele H√§ndler die gleichen Produkte. Trotzdem als Europ√§er sehr sehenswert.
translated_text: Der Markt est sehr voll und man wird als wei√üer sehr viel angequatscht. Im big and ganzen have old handler of the product. Trotzdem als Europ√§er sehr sehenswert.

title: Vale una visita
text: Colori, odori e tanti rumori: un mercato enorme e vivacissimo dove si trova di tutto: dalle stoffe al pesce ad oggetti per la casa. Certo se si √® bianchi, meglio farsi accompagnare, per trovare la strada e non farsi stressare troppo.
translated_text: Colors, smells and rumors: a huge and lively market has everything to do with it: slab of fabric and fish ad oggetti for the house. Certainly if it is white, if you go with it, you will travel along the road and will not stress too much.

title: Nichts f√ºr mich
text: F√ºrchterlicher Markt. Der einzig entspannte Ort ist ein Haus, wo man √ºber 2 Etagen Stoffe kaufen kann. Drau√üen ist nur Gedr√§nge und wirklich besondere Dinge gibt es auch nicht zu kaufen. Ich war froh irgendwann aus dem Chaos  aus St√§nden, Fahrzeugen, Menschen wieder raus zu sein.

title: MARCH√â DANTOKPA
text: Le march√© dantokpa est situ√© au centre de la ville de Cotonou en R√©publique du B√©nin.Le march√© dantokpa l'un des plus grands march√©s de l'Afrique
translated_text: The Dantokpa market is located in the center of the city of Cotonou in the Republic of Benin. The Dantokpa market is one of the largest markets in Africa.

title: Shopping and chaos all around you!
text: We all love a crazy bazaar‚Ä¶ Just be ready for people everywhere inside and out - and of course selling every type of imaginable item whether you can imagine using it or not!
translated_title: Shopping and chaos all around you!
translated_text: We all love a crazy bazaar‚Ä¶ Just be ready for people everywhere inside and out - and of course selling every type of imaginable item whether you can imagine using it or not!

title: Big city market
text: Fortunately I visited Dantokpa with a friend and he knew where to park and how to navigate the market. Great place to find West African cloth of any quality and pattern. Looks like you can find anything here and it's got a busy crowded energy.
translated_text: Fortunately I visited Dantokpa with a friend and he knew where to park and how to navigate the market. Great place to find West African cloth of any quality and pattern. Looks like you can find anything here and it's got a busy crowded energy.

title: Grand March√© de Dantokpa de Cotonou , Un Immense Grand Bazar , tr√®s anim√© !!
text:
Le grand march√© de Cotonou de Dantokpa, se situe au bord de la lagune , qui relie le lac Nokou√© √† l'Oc√©an et juste √† cot√© de la RNIE1 qui traverse Cotonou . Le nom de Dantokpa en langue Fon signifie " Sur les bords de la lagune de Dan " , Dan ( personnage √† trois t√™tes , portant un python sacr√©) √©tant le dieu Vaudou de l'abondance et de la prosp√©rit√© . 

Ce march√© , comporte un grand b√¢timent de 3 niveaux avec des boxes pour la vente et, de plus tout autour , les √©tals constituent un march√© en plein air de plus de 15.000 stands sur 18 ha . Ce qui constitue le march√© le plus grand de l'Afrique de l'Ouest . 
On trouve tout dans ce march√© en gros ou au d√©tail , comme les mat√©riaux  et produits de construction , la quincaillerie ,  jusqu'aux tissus , pagnes , objets de la maison , produits d'entretien . Les fruits et les l√©gumes et agrumes ainsi que les volailles et la viande , sont regroup√©s , ce qui facilite les achats . Lorsqu'on entre dans cet espace , il faut observer les femmes vendeuses de rue , qui portent leur chargement en √©quilibre sur la t√™te ce qui s'av√®re assez spectaculaire . Les porteurs font aussi sensation avec leur rapidit√© de d√©placement dans parfois une foule compacte . 
Les prix se n√©gocient  √¢prement mais si , vous touriste , voulez acheter , attendez vous √† voir les prix grimper . Tout se passe dans une bonne d√©contraction sans √©nervement , m√™me si parfois des palabres enflamm√©s vous font d√©tourner le regard comme s'il s'agissait d'une com√©die bien organis√©e  . Car , les b√©ninois sont taquins et joueurs entre eux , quand ils s'expriment en langue Fon , majoritaire √† Cotonou .
translated_title: Grand March√© de Dantokpa in Cotonou, a huge Grand Bazaar, very lively!!
translated_text: The large Cotonou market of Dantokpa, is located on the edge of the lagoon, which connects Lake Nokou√© to the Ocean and right next to the RNIE1 which crosses Cotonou. The name of Dantokpa in the Fon language means "On the banks of the Dan lagoon", Dan (three-headed character, carrying a sacred python) being the Voodoo god of abundance and prosperity. This market, has a large 3-level building with boxes for sale and, moreover, all around, the stalls constitute an open-air market of more than 15,000 stands on 18 ha. This constitutes the largest market in West Africa. You can find everything in this market wholesale or retail, such as construction materials and products, hardware, up to fabrics, loincloths, household objects, cleaning products. Fruits, vegetables, citrus fruits, poultry, and meat are grouped together, making shopping easier. When you enter this space, you should observe the women street vendors, who balance their loads on their heads, which is quite spectacular. The porters also create a sensation with their speed of movement in sometimes compact crowds. Prices are negotiated fiercely, but if you, as a tourist, want to buy, expect to see prices rise. Everything happens in a relaxed atmosphere without getting nervous, even if sometimes heated discussions make you look away as if it were a well-organized comedy. Because the Beninese are teasing and playful among themselves, when they express themselves in the Fon language, the majority in Cotonou.

title: One of the biggest African markets
text: It could be a frustrating and chaotic experience for non-Africans, but I believe that every traveler should visit this market. You can find many thinks from food, fabrics, handicrafts, etc (it doesn't mean that you will find at a better price. There are smaller markets for that). But still, it is a market that you will have a very good feeling about the daily life of the locals. I also recommend crossing the river with the " pirogue", the wooden boat that the locals use for their transportation
translated_title: One of the biggest African markets
translated_text: It could be a frustrating and chaotic experience for non-Africans, but I believe that every traveler should visit this market. You can find many thinks from food, fabrics, handicrafts, etc (it doesn't mean that you will find at a better price. There are smaller markets for that). But still, it is a market that you will have a very good feeling about the daily life of the locals. I also recommend crossing the river with the " pirogue", the wooden boat that the locals use for their transportation

title: SPECTACULAIRE
text: Gigantesque et vibrant, le march√© √† ne manquer sous aucun pr√©texte √† Cotonou. On s'y perd ais√©ment mais il y a toujours une bonne √¢me pour vous aider √† retrouver votre chemin. Conseil : toujours solliciter l'accord des commer√ßants avant de prendre une photo sous peine de se faire v√©h√©mentement houspill√©. Pittoresque et unique
translated_text: Gigantic and vibrant, this is the market you won't want to miss in Cotonou. It's easy to get lost, but there's always a kind soul to help you find your way. Tip: Always ask the shopkeepers for permission before taking a photo, or you'll be vehemently scolded. Picturesque and unique

title: Wonderful market!
text: I love visiting out door markets when I travel, and this being Africas largest made it to tempting not to visit! I went early, about 8-9 AM because it is cooler. It is busy, sure, but no where have I been able to walk this undisturbed! People greeted me, and when they understood that I do mot speak French, they did their best in English! I just love this people! Oh, did I say that I  was alone, female 50 + and speak no French? It went just fine! But do not be naive, wear your bag in front of you!
translated_text: I love visiting out door markets when I travel, and this being Africas largest made it to tempting not to visit! I went early, about 8-9 AM because it is cooler. It is busy, sure, but no where have I been able to walk this undisturbed! People greeted me, and when they understood that I do mot speak French, they did their best in English! I just love this people! Oh, did I say that I  was alone, female 50 + and speak no French? It went just fine! But do not be naive, wear your bag in front of you!

title: Transfer by bus Lagos Accra
text: To reach Accra from Lagos I took a bus and travelled across Benin and Togo. I remember Blvd St Michel, much traffic under a hot and bright Sun. Unfortunately I could not stop and take a walk there.

title: Belle exp√©rience
text: Tr√®s grand march√© avec une diversit√© de produits tant alimentaire, cosm√©tique et vestimentaire. J'ai trouv√© mon compte. Tr√®s grand march√© avec une forte affluence. Bon accueil des commer√ßants. Je compte y retourner.
translated_text: Very large market with a variety of products, including food, cosmetics, and clothing. I found what I was looking for. Very large market with a large crowd. The traders were very welcoming. I plan to return.

title: Un march√© incroyable
text:
Quelque soit le produit recherch√©, il se trouve √† Dantokpa ! Quel plaisir de se perdre dans les all√©es de ce march√© ville. Il est cependant conseill√© de se faire accompagner pour s'y retrouver et surtout pour bien n√©gocier les tarifs.
Superbes tissus permettant de se faire fabriquer des v√™tements uniques √† prix raisonnables...
Une visite incontournable pour tous voyageurs passant √† Cotonou
translated_text: Whatever product you're looking for, you'll find it in Dantokpa! What a pleasure to get lost in the aisles of this city market. However, it's advisable to be accompanied to find your way around and especially to negotiate the prices. Superb fabrics allow you to have unique clothes made at reasonable prices... A must-see for all travelers passing through Cotonou

title: Une aventure √† part enti√®re
text: √Ä √©viter sans boussole ou sans guide dans un d√©dale d'all√©es et de coursives plus ou moins sp√©cialis√©es.attention aux portefaix qui d√©boulent avec deux poign√©es qui peuvent blesser si vous ne vous garez pas suffisamment vite. Un monde √† part ou la vie pulse et donne l'impression que l'argent circule. L'Afrique au c≈ìur.
translated_title: An adventure in its own right
translated_text: Avoid this place without a compass or a guide in a maze of more or less specialized alleys and passageways. Beware of porters who appear with two handles that can injure you if you don't park quickly enough. A world apart where life pulses and gives the impression that money is circulating. Africa at its heart.

title: Mostly for locals
text: Dantokpa is the largest open air market in West Africa. It covers more than 20 hectares, has 5.000 selling points and "employs" 25.000 people! Merchants mainly ell multicolored fabrics, foodstuff, alcoholic beverages, clothes and shoes, household electrical appliances, mobile phones, spare parts for cars, motorcycles and bicycles, cosmetics, household chemicals, jewelry, bijoux, as well as religious items and handicrafts. It is mostly oriented for locals. If you need souvenirs, it is better to visit Artesian village (centre Artisanal) close to Hall des Arts, Loisirs et Sports.
translated_text: Dantokpa is the largest open air market in West Africa. It covers more than 20 hectares, has 5.000 selling points and "employs" 25.000 people! Merchants mainly ell multicolored fabrics, foodstuff, alcoholic beverages, clothes and shoes, household electrical appliances, mobile phones, spare parts for cars, motorcycles and bicycles, cosmetics, household chemicals, jewelry, bijoux, as well as religious items and handicrafts. It is mostly oriented for locals. If you need souvenirs, it is better to visit Artesian village (centre Artisanal) close to Hall des Arts, Loisirs et Sports.

title: Tr√®s grand march√©
text:
Ce march√© est vraiment tr√®s grand / enorme. 
On y trouve beaucoup de produits diff√©rents ; et cela est am√©nager par zone. Zone pour les poissons, pour les habits, pour les chaussures, fruits, ... 
De nombreux d√©dales / all√©es ou on peut se perdre ; ou devoir marcher pour trouver une sortie pour tenter de se r√©p√©rer. 
Activit√© qui m√©rite d'y aller, pour flaner, d√©couvrir des produits, ramener des produits, trouver de quoi manger, ...
translated_text: This market is really very big / huge. There are many different products there; and it is arranged by zone. Zone for fish, for clothes, for shoes, fruits, ... Many mazes / alleys where you can get lost; or have to walk to find an exit to try to find your way. Activity that is worth going there, to stroll, discover products, bring back products, find something to eat, ...

title: Not for the fainthearted
text: The market is large and there is also a building with 2 stories of kiosks mainly selling material and jewellery. If it has just been raining, the sellers take longer to open their kiosks and the outside area becomes muddy and messy with lots of muck and puddles. Beware of guys claiming to be security and offering to show you around free of charge. They insist on accompanying you and get very grumpy if you don't give them at the end. We visited the fetishes market as well. It is part of the larger market. It may well shock you to see live rats, cats, tortoises and egrets in cages. There were also heads of horses, dogs, baboons and monkeys for sale. Dead parrots, snakes and barn owls abounded.I am not sure if any of this decimation of wildlife is respectful of CITES. I rather think not. They even had a leopard's head. If you care for nature don't go there, because even a casual walk-through can be interpreted as interest in the animal products on sale.
translated_text: The market is large and there is also a building with 2 stories of kiosks mainly selling material and jewellery. If it has just been raining, the sellers take longer to open their kiosks and the outside area becomes muddy and messy with lots of muck and puddles. Beware of guys claiming to be security and offering to show you around free of charge. They insist on accompanying you and get very grumpy if you don't give them at the end. We visited the fetishes market as well. It is part of the larger market. It may well shock you to see live rats, cats, tortoises and egrets in cages. There were also heads of horses, dogs, baboons and monkeys for sale. Dead parrots, snakes and barn owls abounded.I am not sure if any of this decimation of wildlife is respectful of CITES. I rather think not. They even had a leopard's head. If you care for nature don't go there, because even a casual walk-through can be interpreted as interest in the animal products on sale.

title: The typical city Market
text: It is a very interesting place for visitors that are visiting Benin republic for the first time. It is a quick and practical way of meeting the people. There are diverse items here to be purchased but the negotiation for the prices of products could be frustrating. The market is diverse culturally as different tribes are represented. And do not be surprised if you hear someone speak your native language, where ever you may come from.
translated_text: It is a very interesting place for visitors that are visiting Benin republic for the first time. It is a quick and practical way of meeting the people. There are diverse items here to be purchased but the negotiation for the prices of products could be frustrating. The market is diverse culturally as different tribes are represented. And do not be surprised if you hear someone speak your native language, where ever you may come from.

title: L'un des grands marche de Cotonou.
text: On est ici plong√© dans l'ambiance b√©ninoise. D'echoppes en √©choppes on passe des fruits aux l√©gumes et √† tous ce qui peut se vendre. Les couleurs, les odeurs et les vendeurs nous font changer de monde. Magnifique.
translated_title: One of the big markets in Cotonou.
translated_text: Here we are immersed in the Beninese atmosphere. From stall to stall, we pass from fruits to vegetables and everything else that can be sold. The colors, the smells, and the vendors transport us to another world. Magnificent.

title: Ce march√©, vieux de plus d'un si√®cle
text: C'est √©patant, je l'ai d√©couvert grandiose, grouillant de monde de toutes nationalit√©s, et de vendeurs de toutes natures et de toutes choses commerciales, c'est un lieu impressionnant que je recommande √† toutes personnes visitant Cotonou. Il est l√†, aux abords d'un fleuve majestueux, dont les explications d'origine t√©moignent du nom conf√©r√© √† ce gigantesque march√©. √ßa fait peur, ce nom de march√© qui m'a fait penser le contraire. Pourquoi pas Mawutokpa ?
translated_title: This market, more than a century old
translated_text: It's amazing, I found it grandiose, teeming with people of all nationalities, and vendors of all kinds and all commercial things, it's an impressive place that I recommend to anyone visiting Cotonou. It's there, on the banks of a majestic river, whose explanations of origin testify to the name given to this gigantic market. It's scary, this market name that made me think the opposite. Why not Mawutokpa?

title: Awesome
text: Beautiful, colourful, smelly, crowdy street market where you can find almost everything you may need. Get prepared to negotiate for hours for every little thing. The only non-negotiable prices are for wax tissues (there are so many!). Definitely my favourite place in Cotonou.
translated_text: Beautiful, colourful, smelly, crowdy street market where you can find almost everything you may need. Get prepared to negotiate for hours for every little thing. The only non-negotiable prices are for wax tissues (there are so many!). Definitely my favourite place in Cotonou.

title: M√©rite la visite
text:
√âvidemment le Yovo est sans cesse interpell√©, autrement pas de harc√®lement ou malhonn√™tet√©, les vendeurs sont sympathiques, curieux ou vous ignorent. 
Les milliers de stands offrent pl√©thore et vari√©t√© de tout ce que l'on peut trouver √† Cotonou, n√©gociations de rigueur. 
Couleurs, sourires, parfums, odeurs et interactions, un lieu de vie et d'√©change devenu symbole du commerce ouest africain.
translated_text: Obviously, Yovo is constantly being called out, but otherwise, there's no harassment or dishonesty; the vendors are friendly, curious, or simply ignore you. The thousands of stalls offer a plethora and variety of everything you can find in Cotonou, with bargaining required. Colors, smiles, scents, smells, and interactions‚Äîa place of life and exchange that has become a symbol of West African commerce.

title: Gigantesque
text: Ce march√© est particuli√®rement impressionnant. Des milliers de stand de tissus, nourritures et autres bibelots. Juste gigantesque. A faire imp√©rativement si vous venez √† Cotonou ou aux abords.
translated_text: This market is particularly impressive. Thousands of stalls selling fabrics, food, and other trinkets. Simply gigantic. A must-see if you're in Cotonou or the surrounding area.

title: Dantokpa 2017
text:
√ânorme March√© ou on trouve de tout ! 
Vivement recommand√© si vous passez au B√©nin.

Beaucoup de monde donc il faut savoir prendre son mal en patience.

La n√©gociation est de rigueur !
translated_text: Huge market where you can find everything! Highly recommended if you're in Benin. Lots of people, so you have to be patient. Bargaining is essential!

title: march√© international
text: vous trouverez tout ce dont vous pouvez avoir besoin divers, cosm√©tiques, pi√®ces d√©tach√©s pour voitures etc
translated_text: You will find everything you need, including cosmetics, car spare parts, etc.

title: Une fois dans la vie ... juste pour savoir
text: D√©j√† la premi√®re fois je me suis jur√© de ne plus jamais mettre pied dans Dantokpa. Malheureusement, on m'a convaincu que j'exag√©rais et que ce serait bien de tenter encore une fois. H√©las, le march√© est impossible √† visiter pour un blanc car on est constamment harcel√© par des d√©marcheurs, on n'ose m√™me pas √† s'arr√™ter pour jeter un coup d'oeuil. Et m√™me si on cherche un article particulier, soyez certain, que vous en d√©hors de toute n√©gociation qui se fait entre des personnes parfaitement inconnu et qui vous imposent un prix. par la Suite, vous ne pouvez pas partir sans qu'on vous soutire des Sous pour des "Services rendus". l'nsemble dans un vacarme assourdissant et une chaleur √©touffante sans cesse oblig√© d'√©viter des autres visiteurs ou des charriots ou autres transporteurs et ambulants. Si un jour vous voulez y aller, juste pour faire l'exp√©rience, assurez vous d'√™tre accompagn√© d'une personne de confiance qui maitrise la langue et les coutumes.
translated_title: Once in a lifetime... just to know
translated_text: Already the first time I swore to myself never to set foot in Dantokpa again. Unfortunately, I was convinced that I was exaggerating and that it would be good to try again. Alas, the market is impossible to visit for a white person because you are constantly harassed by touts, you don't even dare to stop to take a look. And even if you are looking for a particular item, be sure, that you are outside of any negotiation that takes place between people completely unknown and who impose a price on you. Subsequently, you cannot leave without being extorted money from you for "Services rendered". All in a deafening din and stifling heat, constantly forced to avoid other visitors or carts or other transporters and street vendors. If one day you want to go there, just to experience it, make sure you are accompanied by a trustworthy person who masters the language and customs.

title: un lieu haut en couleurs

text: Het echte leven zoals het in Afrika is. Je vind er alles; eten , stoffen, vodoo medicijnen , kruiden,

title: Rather rowdy and stressful
text: I was unable to buy anything because the market was too stressful and extremely rowdy. I left with nothing.
translated_text: I was unable to buy anything because the market was too stressful and extremely rowdy. I left with nothing.

title: Incontournable
text:
M√™me si on n'y ach√®te rien il faut y aller pour les couleurs, les odeurs, l'ambiance. 
Et un guide s'impose ou on s'y perd vite !
translated_text: Even if you don't buy anything there, you have to go for the colors, the smells, the atmosphere. And a guide is essential or you'll quickly get lost!

title: El mercado m√°s grande de Africa del Oeste
text: Un lugar donde consigues de todo a precios razonables, aunque es obligatorio el negociar los precios! Un buen lugar si deseas descubrir en verdad,como yo le digo, la otra cara de Africa... Los ni√±os de la calle abundan en este mercado, donde vienen a trabajar para ganar el pan de cada dia. Es una experiencia que te hace abrir los ojos a la realidad y ver lo afortunados que somos...
translated_title: The biggest market in Western Africa
translated_text: A place where you have to pay reasonable prices, but it is obligatory to negotiate the prices! A good place to be if you want to discover it in the green, like the digo, the other cara of Africa... The children of the Calle Abundan in this market, they come to work to win the side of their country. It is an experience that allows you to shelter your eyes in reality and see the fortunate people that you...

title: Love
text: C'est  un march√© rempli d'amour, et si tu n'as  pas la ma√Ætrise  tu peux  te perdre. Je l'aime beaucoup car il y a tout dedans  .
translated_text: It's a market full of love, and if you don't have control you can get lost. I like it a lot because it has everything in it.

title: Stressful but rewarding
text:
Dantokpa boasts of a variety of goods and if you are not careful, you are sure to go above your budget. 

Loads of colourful and lovely ankara (African prints) to be purchased from here. Be sure to always bargain cos prices quoted are way higher than the sale price.
translated_text:
Dantokpa boasts of a variety of goods and if you are not careful, you are sure to go above your budget. 

Loads of colourful and lovely ankara (African prints) to be purchased from here. Be sure to always bargain cos prices quoted are way higher than the sale price.

title: Everything
text:
Marche Dantokpa has everything. Fast moving, feels safe, lots of fabrics. Baguettes & mini doughnuts for sale as you walk around.
Prices are quoted higher for Yovo's, so go about ‚Öì of what is quoted.
translated_text:
Marche Dantokpa has everything. Fast moving, feels safe, lots of fabrics. Baguettes & mini doughnuts for sale as you walk around.
Prices are quoted higher for Yovo's, so go about ‚Öì of what is quoted.

title: Le plus grand march√© d'Afrique de l'Oeust
text: Fruits et l√©gumes, condiments et √©pices, tissus et bijoux, produits aquatiques ... Tout s'y trouve et tout s'y n√©gocie. Se requinquer avant de sillonner les all√©es du march√© pour faire fasse au dynamisme et √† l'√©nergie des marchandes.
translated_title: The largest market in West Africa
translated_text: Fruits and vegetables, condiments and spices, fabrics and jewelry, seafood... Everything is there and everything is bargained for. Recharge your batteries before wandering the market aisles to experience the dynamism and energy of the vendors.

title: c'est un march√© international on y trouve de tout .
text: il y a des guides ou des d√©marcheurs qui vous aident facilement √† vous orienter pour vos achats.il faut pr√©voir un appareil photo pour capturer les paysages les plus insolites car au march√© Dantokpa on y voir de toutes les couleurs des vendeuses ambulantes d√©ambulant avec leur √©tate sur la t√™te.
translated_title: It's an international market where you can find everything.
translated_text: There are guides or salespeople who can easily help you find your way around your purchases. You should bring a camera to capture the most unusual landscapes because at the Dantokpa market you can see all sorts of street vendors wandering around with their clothes on their heads.

title: Interesting.  Very big but not stressful.  Good for African prints and jewellery
text: Visited twice during five - day stay in Cotonou.  Big and busy.   Had a guide to take us to jewellery and fabrics sections. Prices reasonable.
translated_title: Interesting.  Very big but not stressful.  Good for African prints and jewellery
translated_text: Visited twice during five - day stay in Cotonou.  Big and busy.   Had a guide to take us to jewellery and fabrics sections. Prices reasonable.

title: Main and Major Market in Cotonou.
text:
This Marche Dantokpa consist of all the things that you wish to buy in Cotonou in retails, both African designers wears made in BENIN Republic, Motor spare parts, Fish, African food stuffs, located opposite the CITY Center Mall known for currency exchange, Gold jeweries, and Lace Fabrics in just across the road, This Marche Dantokpa is near MISSEBO Market in 5minutes walking where you will get where you will get every impoted food stuffs in wholesales, and crucery shops, and Imported Used cloths and retailers. 
Marche Dantokpa is a central Market in Cotonou that combines all other Markets in Cotonou city such that everything that you want is in a place in Cotonou but a Large place. I mean to say that you don't need to enter transport to another Market once in DANTOKPA everything is at your reach, just make inquiry.

title: plus grand march√© d'Afrique de l'Ouest
text: immense, des milliers de boutiques, de tout, de tout, de tout, du monde, des cris, du bruit, et n'oubliez pas de marchander ! le must : le march√© aux pagnes, des tissus WAX en veux tu en voila.

title: In renovation in this moment
text:
It was a very good market in Cotonou. Very recently there was a fire and many damage but the government is doing his best to get back this place. So just way a little bit to see this over with all the good things could interest people or tourists.
But for who had get visited this place once more, you could come and see how are going the reconstructions of the locals.

title: Marche Dantokpa
text: I find this market a bit laid back compared to where I am coming from. Lots of nice Ankara fabrics. The locals are warm and the only challenge may be the language barrier.

title: marche dantokpa
text: le marche dantokpa situe au benin precisement en pleine ville de cotonou est l'un des plus grands marche en l'afrique de l'ouest
translated_text: The Dantokpa market, located in Benin, precisely in the heart of Cotonou, is one of the largest markets in West Africa.

title: Um dos lugares mais loucos que j√° fui
text:
O mercado √© algo absurdo de grande e parece que todos aqueles esteri√≥tipos da Africa se concentram num mesmo lugar. 
Policiais pedindo propinas para os turistas - sen√£o levar√£o sua m√°quina porque √© "proibido tirar fotos", lama, pessoas urinando por todos os lados, sujeira. Mas merece ser visitado. As pessoas s√£o lindas e (algumas bem) simp√°ticas.

Policiais pedindo propinas para turistas - sen√£o levar√£o su a m√°quina porque √© "proibido tirar photos", lama, pessoas urinando por allos os lados, sujeira. But only be visited. As these are easy to understand and (algumas bem) simp√°ticas.

title: Circulez ! Il y a tout √† voir...
text: Une tr√®s bonne entr√©e en mati√®re du B√©nin profond, les bons et les mauvais aspects, le travail des enfants, la richesse des produits √©tal√©s, l'ambiance chaleureuse et gentille (sauf avec l'appareil photo arm√©...) On est Yovo, certes mais accueilli.
translated_title: Move along! There's so much to see...
translated_text: A very good introduction to the depths of Benin, the good and bad aspects, the child labor, the richness of the products on display, the warm and friendly atmosphere (except with the armed camera...) We are Yovo, certainly, but welcomed.

title: Ankara market
text: Large African styled market. We were able to shop for very nice African fabrics at good price. Not much haggling with the experienced market women who were very pleasant.
translated_text: Large African styled market. We were able to shop for very nice African fabrics at good price. Not much haggling with the experienced market women who were very pleasant.

title: Immenso
text: √à uno spettacolo girare per questo mercato , tanta puzza e tanto caos accompagnano una visita di questo gigantesco mercato dove ci trovi di tutto
translated_text: There is a spettacolo girare per this mercato, tanta puzza and tanto caos accompanies a visit of this gigantesco mercato dove ci trovi di tutto

title: Un autre monde
text:
Ce march√© est immense. Ce march√© est d√©paysant. Ce march√© est d'odeurs, de couleurs, de langues diverses, d'√©clats de rires, de disputes, de marchandages, de tout un monde totalement √©loign√© de ce que l'Europ√©en peut conna√Ætre, voire imaginer.

Si vous passez par Cotonou, il faut le d√©couvrir. 

Accompagn√© d'un ou d'une autochtone de pr√©f√©rence. Pour le marchandage (une n√©cessit√© absolue et coutumi√®re), pour la tranquillit√© aussi √©ventuellement.

Sous cette double condition, vos yeux, vos narines, vos oreilles, voire votre toucher seront d√©pays√©s et, si vous √™tes ouvert √† la diff√©rence, combl√©s.
translated_text: This market is immense. This market is exotic. This market is filled with smells, colors, diverse languages, bursts of laughter, arguments, bargaining, a whole world completely removed from what a European can know, or even imagine. If you pass through Cotonou, you must discover it. Preferably accompanied by a local. For the bargaining (an absolute and customary necessity), and possibly for the tranquility too. Under these two conditions, your eyes, your nostrils, your ears, even your touch will be transported and, if you are open to difference, fulfilled.

title: Usual African market
text:
Worth a quick look
Fairly big
Usual fruit veg and everything else
Very dirty streets
No hassle there much
Take a mototaxi there for 300 cfa

title: Immense march√©
text:
Le plus grand march√© de l'afrique de l'ouest, une ville dans la ville!
A faire lors d'un s√©jour √† Cotonou pour prendre le temps de se promener et de se perdre.
translated_text: The largest market in West Africa, a city within a city! A must-see during a stay in Cotonou, take the time to wander around and get lost.

title: Auf jeden Fall einen Besuch wert; aber Vorsicht !
text: Es ist nicht √ºbertrieben, dass der Dantopka- Markt als einer der gr√∂√üten Westafrikas gepriesen wird. Aber das Gr√∂√üte muss nicht immer auch das Beste sein. Wer schon mehrere dieser M√§rkte in den Nachbarl√§ndern gesehen hat, der wird hier nicht in √ºberm√§√üige Begeisterun g ausbrechen. Nur wer sich in Cotonou aufh√§lt, f√ºr den ist der Marktbesuch ( nicht unter 2 Stunde ) schon ein Muss., Leider gibt es immer √Ñrger, wenn man Pewrsonen fotografieren will. Das reicht von Abwinken bis zum enrgioschen No. Auf jeden fall immer vorher fragen oder noch besser ist es, mit dem tele sich die Motive suchen. Achtung am Fetischmarkt: Hier kommt es zu Agressionen, wenn der  daher kommende  Tourist meint, er k√∂nne die Kadaver und Fetische einfach ablichten. So manch einer hat deswegen schon fluchtartig die St√§nde verlassen. Daher keine ostentive Fotos ohne das o.K. oder Besuch des Marktes mit einem der sich zahlreich anbietenden F√ºhrer !
translated_title: Auf jeden Fall einen Besuch wert; aber Vorsicht !
translated_text: Es ist nicht √ºbertrieben, dass der Dantopka- Markt als einer der gr√∂√üten Westafrikas gepriesen wird. Aber das Gr√∂√üte muss nicht immer auch das Beste sein. Wer schon mehrere dieser M√§rkte in den Nachbarl√§ndern gesehen hat, der wird hier nicht in √ºberm√§√üige Begeisterun g ausbrechen. Nur wer sich in Cotonou aufh√§lt, f√ºr den ist der Marktbesuch ( nicht unter 2 Stunde ) schon ein Muss., Leider gibt es immer √Ñrger, wenn man Pewrsonen fotografieren will. Das reicht von Abwinken bis zum enrgioschen No. Auf jeden fall immer vorher fragen oder noch besser ist es, mit dem tele sich die Motive suchen. Achtung am Fetischmarkt: Hier kommt es zu Agressionen, wenn der  daher kommende  Tourist meint, er k√∂nne die Kadaver und Fetische einfach ablichten. So manch einer hat deswegen schon fluchtartig die St√§nde verlassen. Daher keine ostentive Fotos ohne das o.K. oder Besuch des Marktes mit einem der sich zahlreich anbietenden F√ºhrer !

title: d√©paysement total
text:
En s'immergeant dans le march√© Dantkpa, on se croirait presque dans un autre monde, ou plut√¥t dans un autre temps...
Tout vous saisit: le bruit, la foule , les odeurs, les senteurs, les "p√©tarades" et la fum√©e des zems et des mobylettes  qui tentent ( et qui y parviennent...) de se frayer un passage aux abords imm√©diats du march√©, au milieu parfois de la foule.
On y trouve de tout, on se demande comment de si petites boutiques (pour certaines) peuvent abriter tant de choses.
Mais mieux vaut √™tre accompagn√© en ces lieux ou s√©vissent les pick pockets.
Il faut savoir que des commer√ßants vivent l√†, vendent la journ√©e et y dorment la nuit, font leur popote et sans doute...Le reste...
Bref, un endroit tr√®s anim√© et tr√®s typique, c'est √† voir.

Par contre, j'√©mettrais tout de m√™me une critique tr√®s s√©v√®re... En effet, j'ai v√©cu √† Cotonou il y a bien des ann√©es, une cinquantaine pour √™tre plus exact et, le long du march√© se trouvait une lagune dont les eaux √©taient alors d'une clart√© √©blouissante, un lieu privil√©gi√© o√π il faisit bon se baigner, loin des vagues et des courants de la c√¥te.
C'√©tait un endroit paradisiaque ! Quand j'ai vu ce que cette lagune √©tait devenue ( on y jette tous les d√©chets du march√©, et ceux des humains √©galement...) ...Cette magnifique lagune n'est plus qu'un immense d√©potoir dans lequel les poissons eux m√™me doivent avoir peur de se baigner.

Dommage donc que cet immense march√© ait d√©truit l'environnement.
C'est d√©solant !

J'√©prouve un immense regret en pensant √† "ma" lagune et des b√©ninois auxquels j'ai pu montrer des photos de ce site merveilleux se sont eux m√™me √©cri√©s: " Mon Dieu ! Qu'est ce qu'on a fait ? !!! "
translated_text: By immersing yourself in the Dantkpa market, you almost feel like you are in another world, or rather in another time... Everything grabs you: the noise, the crowd, the smells, the scents, the "backfires" and the smoke of the zems and mopeds that try (and succeed...) to make their way to the immediate vicinity of the market, sometimes in the middle of the crowd. You can find everything there, you wonder how such small shops (for some) can house so many things. But it is better to be accompanied in these places where pickpockets are rife. You should know that traders live there, sell during the day and sleep there at night, cook their meals and probably... The rest... In short, a very lively and very typical place, it is worth seeing. On the other hand, I would still make a very severe criticism... Indeed, I lived in Cotonou many years ago, about fifty to be more exact, and along the market there was a lagoon whose waters were then of a dazzling clarity, a privileged place where it was good to bathe, far from the waves and currents of the coast. It was a heavenly place! When I saw what this lagoon had become (they throw all the waste from the market there, and that of humans too...) ...This magnificent lagoon is nothing more than a huge dump in which the fish themselves must be afraid to bathe. It is a shame that this huge market has destroyed the environment. It is distressing! I feel immense regret when I think of "my" lagoon and Beninese people to whom I was able to show photos of this marvelous site themselves cried out: "My God! What have we done?!!!"

title: March√©-D√©couverte!
text:
Le march√© Dantokpa est le plus grand de l'Afrique de l'Ouest. Il est tr√®s anim√© et on y rencontre toutes les nationalit√©s africaines et m√™me au-del√†. On trouve tout √† l'int√©rieur de ce march√© quelque soit l'article recherch√©. C'est un grand centre d'affaire brillamment tenu par de braves femmes pour la plupart. Pour bien visiter ce march√© et faire de bonnes affaires, il faut y passer plusieurs heures. Mais attention aux pick-pockets qui y sont nombreux. Je vous conseille de faire la visite √† plusieurs et d'√™tre tr√®s vigilants.
Malheureusement, ledit march√© est tr√®s encombr√© et on s'y d√©place difficilement surtout les jours de march√© ( tous les cinq jours) o√π ce lieu est gorg√© de monde.
translated_text: The Dantokpa market is the largest in West Africa. It is very lively and you can meet all African nationalities and even beyond. You can find everything inside this market whatever the item you are looking for. It is a large business center brilliantly run by brave women for the most part. To visit this market properly and make good deals, you have to spend several hours there. But beware of pickpockets who are numerous there. I advise you to visit with several people and to be very vigilant. Unfortunately, the said market is very crowded and it is difficult to move around, especially on market days (every five days) when this place is full of people.

title: Outdoor shopping marvel
text: Marche Dantokpa is huge.  Anything you want, you can find here, but be prepared to walk around.  The only way to really appreciate the market is to walk around and see the different vendors and bargain.  The best time to go is at the end of the day when vendors really want to sell you can get your best deals.  Aside from shoppoing for goods you can also by local food here.  Make sure you have a strong stomach and a healthy appetite.
translated_text: Marche Dantokpa is huge.  Anything you want, you can find here, but be prepared to walk around.  The only way to really appreciate the market is to walk around and see the different vendors and bargain.  The best time to go is at the end of the day when vendors really want to sell you can get your best deals.  Aside from shoppoing for goods you can also by local food here.  Make sure you have a strong stomach and a healthy appetite.

title: Spectacular
text: If you're not afraid of crowds and if you like lively colors and people, you really should visit Dantokpa. For a first time it helps to be accompanied by a guide, because not knowing some landmarks, makes it easy to get lost. It really is a pleasure to walk and look around. People are not bothering you to much,  be a bit discrete though about taking pictures, because not everybody likes that. A must for somebody who likes African markets.
translated_text: If you're not afraid of crowds and if you like lively colors and people, you really should visit Dantokpa. For a first time it helps to be accompanied by a guide, because not knowing some landmarks, makes it easy to get lost. It really is a pleasure to walk and look around. People are not bothering you to much,  be a bit discrete though about taking pictures, because not everybody likes that. A must for somebody who likes African markets.

title: What a sight! Worth a visit!
text: This is the largest market we have ever seen!  We didn't have enough time to walk around. So we saw the market from the comfort of our car.  We drove from street to street seeing different sections where different types of merchandise are sold.  You can probably find ANYTHING that you need there.  So it's organized in the sense that there are different sections for different things, but not organize within each section...or it's organized in the west-african logic.  We didn't buy anything but we were told that prices are good, especially if you are a good bargainer.
translated_title: What a sight! Worth a visit!
translated_text: This is the largest market we have ever seen!  We didn't have enough time to walk around. So we saw the market from the comfort of our car.  We drove from street to street seeing different sections where different types of merchandise are sold.  You can probably find ANYTHING that you need there.  So it's organized in the sense that there are different sections for different things, but not organize within each section...or it's organized in the west-african logic.  We didn't buy anything but we were told that prices are good, especially if you are a good bargainer.

title: Le plus Grand March√© de L'Afrique de l'ouest
text: J'ai travaill√© dans le march√© Dantokpa et je crois que le march√© est tr√®s bien organiser. Les rues sont divis√©s par sujet (ex. √©lectronique, pi√®ces de voitures, v√™tements etc.) Il suffit de passer un peu de temps et d√©couvrir toute les facettes de ce march√©. C'est en fait le plus grand march√© de l'Afrique de l'Ouest au niveau des √©changes commerciales et je crois en superficie aussi mais cette information reste a v√©rifier. SI vous avez quelques heures et bien je vous recommande cette visite, un incontournable de la ville.
translated_title: The largest market in West Africa
translated_text: I worked in the Dantokpa market and I believe that the market is very well organized. The streets are divided by subject (e.g. electronics, car parts, clothing etc.) Just spend a little time and discover all the facets of this market. It is in fact the largest market in West Africa in terms of trade and I believe in area too but this information remains to be verified. If you have a few hours and well I recommend this visit, a must-see in the city.

title: Trop touffu
text: Le march√© n'est pas bien ordonn√©. Ce qui rend la circulation un peu difficile au sein du march√©
translated_text: The market is not well organized, which makes it a bit difficult to move around the market.
